title: Wall Street Sanctions Against Russia, Alaska
sub_head: Isn’t it time for U.S. financial institutions to stop discriminating against U.S. petroleum production?
body:
Continental Resources founder Harold Hamm, unofficial prime minister of America’s energy-rich Cowboyistan region, explains in a Journal op-ed the Biden administration’s hostility to U.S. energy production. The hostility is not limited to government. Discouraging U.S. energy production has become one of the financial industry’s favorite phony virtue signals. Some veteran Wall Streeters say these days the aggressive leftist politics of the wokesters inside their own firms create even bigger headaches than the regulators. But as financial firms race to cut ties with Vladimir Putin and even the Germans now understand the folly of encouraging petro-dictators to dominate oil and gas supplies, isn’t it time for Wall Street to lift its economic sanctions against U.S. energy firms on Main Street?
